intro: Metcalfia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy flowers that bloom in summer. Metcalfia mexicana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to drought conditions.
